page.title: 13MEDIA
page.content: BBC North, Yorkshire T.V. and Radio Lincolnshire include our area. The Lincolnshire Standard has a section covering Horncastle but the Horncastle News is the only completely local newspaper. 6500 copies of the Horncastle News are printed in Horncastle every week plus 300000 other papers for places throughout the country. There is over Â£1,000,000 worth of machinery and Â£350,000 worth of computers at the new factory which provides employment for about 50 people. The paper, each roll measuring 4 miles, is imported from Scandinavia and Canada. There are 6 reporters who rely on local correspondents and the public to inform them of events taking place within a radius of about 10 miles. The paper was started in September 1885 by Mr Morton and is now run by Mr Phillip Sharp.
